map.title: [IT] Economic and International Trade Indicators
map.body:
This section provides a map displaying for each country the total population and some macro-economic indicators and trade and exchanged goods for import and export in 2019 and in 2019 and in 2019 and 2020.

Further the component provides a time-lapse functionality to represent the international trade monthly variations for the last twelve months.

graph.title: [IT] International Trade Relations
graph.body:
This section shows the graph plot of international trade based on COMEXT transport data, along with relevant global and local measures detailing the structure of countries relations. The panel is interactive, providing the possibility to apply several filters and to see how the graph structure and measures change accordingly.

Furthermore an animation is provided showing the evolution of the international trade graph over time, spanning the entire time window of trading data.

timeseries.title: [IT] Time Series visualization
timeseries.body: Effective visualization tool for monthly Comext foreign trade data series. despite the amount of underlying data, they allow an easily understandable reading. useful as a dissemination tool. series are provided in value and quantity, with indication of descriptive statistics and the possibility of downloading

trade.title: [IT] Changes in basket composition of traded products (CPA - classification of products by activity) by Member State
trade.body: This section provides, for each Member State, the 2020 monthly time series of year-over-year changes in the basket composition of exported and imported goods, classified according to CPA-2 digits.

main.title: [IT] International Trade Relations
main.body:
[IT] The 'International Trade Relations' Panel shows the graph analysis of the international trades between countries.
Data are relative to all trades between countries present in the Comext dataset. The requested data can be selected through filters. Countries are identified by their flags and their relative positions in the graph are given by the “Spring layout algorithm” implemented in the Networkx library.

filter.title: [IT] International Trade Relations
filter.body:
[IT]Period: select the required time period for data underlying the graph (specific month or year)
Percentage: select the percentage of data shown in the graph (integer value from 0 to 100). Once the percentage value is selected the data are filtered according to the following procedure: all the amounts traded between countries (all edges) are listed in a descending order, then the cumulative sum is calculated along the list. All the trades associated to a cumulative sum above the percentage value, taken as threshold, are filtered out. This means that small trading amounts are considered in the graph only when “percentage” takes an high value.
Transport: select data relative to the means of transport used in the trades. The listed means of transport are: “unknown”, “sea”, “rail”, “road”, ”air”, “post”, “fixed mechanism”, “inland waterway”, “self-propulsion”.
Product: select data relative to the product exchanged in the trades. The user can select either a single product or all of them together.
Flow: select either “Export” data or “Import” data, coming from
Weight: select the type of graph analysis. “True” select the weighted type of graph, “False” select the unweighted type of graph. Values for the links weights are the amounts exchanged in the trades.

metrics.title: [IT]
metrics.body:
[IT] The following metrics derive from standard centrality measures of Graph Analysis.
Product spread: graph density. Represents how much the product is spread through the graph.
Vulnerability: it is calculated as 1 - the indegree centrality for each country. The vulnerability conveys the message that a country receiving a product from several countries is less dependent on singles countries for the product supply.
Exportation strength: it is the outdegree centrality for each country.
Hubness: it is the betweenness centrality of the countries.
